title: The 11th Hour
description: Why are environmentalists so concerned about what's going on with the planet? To understand our point of view a video like the Eleventh Hour is an excellent place to start. Narrated by Leonardo Di Caprio, beautifully shot and very accessible film. Hopefully will change the way you think. (Unfortunately this is no longer available free online...not sure what the thinking is there)

title: Making the Connection
description: Created by Environment Films, this video introduces you to various aspects of the Vegan lifestyle and answers some common misconceptions about it. I make an appearance in it later on in the Environment section. This is just my section, but I'd encourage you to click the link above and watch them all.
extra_content: <object><param name="movie" value="http://www.youtube.com/v/_7RlPSk4t-Y?version=3"><param name="allowFullScreen" value="true"><param name="allowScriptAccess" value="always"><embed src="http://www.youtube.com/v/_7RlPSk4t-Y?version=3" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" allowfullscreen="true" allowScriptAccess="always"></object>

title: Earthlings
description: Quite simply the best documentary on the negative sides of how we treat animals. I tried getting people who asked "Why are you vegan?" to watch this, but they wouldn't. I can only imagine this is because they know what they are going to see, and it is going to confront them with questions of morality they are afraid to ask. Every time you purchase an animal product you are casting a vote for how those animals live their lives. Seeing as you have this control over the lives of animals, the least you can do is educate yourself as to what you are supporting. This video will start that education.

title: The Century of the Self
description: One of the most important documentary series on the Internet. How have the rise of the understanding of human psychology started by Freud come to be used to manipulate the population of developed countries. Must see viewing.  Watch it, then question everything it says.

title: Manufacturing Consent
description: This is probably the best documentary made about Noam Chomsky. If you need an insight into the politics of Chomsky, who I think is the most important intellectual alive, then this is a great place to start. Someone once said to not have read Chomsky is to court genuine ignorance, you can at least start addressing that by watching this excellent video.

title: Orwell Rolls in his Grave
description: The title refers to a common phrase people use in talking about todays media. We cannot have a functioning democracy without a open and unbiased media. This documentary about the media system unveils the barriers we have in getting the information needed to make the important decisions about our societies and world.

title: Philosophy : A Guide to Happiness
description: Alain de Botton wrote a wonderful book called "The Consolations of Philosophy" about how great philosophers had discussed things very relevant to our everyday lives. They've given the TV series made about this a more upbeat title, but it is a highly informative and entertaining. This one about Epicurus is particularly good.

title: The Virus of Faith
description: Richard Dawkins excellent documentary about the negative and irrational sides of religion. He is a little intolerant himself sometimes, but like many commentators after September the 11th he considers that religion needs a greater challenge in the world. If nothing else, he has encouraged athiests to be more upfront about their views, and that in itself is an antidote to this particular virus.

title: Athiesm : A Brief History of Disbelief
description: An entertaining documentary by Jonathan Miller discussing atheism and parts of it's history. Includes discussion with contemporary philosophers and wonderful quotes from past ones.

title: The New Rulers of the World
description: John Pilger, perhaps the greatest political documentary maker of our times, looks at the efforts by the global elite to exploit the people and resources of poorer, less powerful countries. When we look at the so called developing world, we need to understand how deliberately some of those countries have been kept subservient by more developed countries. The video link also goes to a full list of his videos on many topics.

title: Palestine is Still the Issue
description: Another fabulous documentary by John Pilger. Most people I know don't have a shred of antisemetism in them, perhaps like myself they even have a positive bias towards the Jewish culture, ancient and learned as it is. This is completely separate to my condemnation of the actions of the Israeli government in the occupied territories. We cannot wash away our moral failings by blaming them on the provocations of others, Israel must end it's occupation of Palestine and help them develop into a viable nation. Any hope of peace in the middle east is in their hands.

title: We: Arundhuti Roy
description: A beautiful mix of the words of this wonderful Indian author, music by some great bands and visceral images. Political and cool, put this on in the background of your next party.

title: Waste = Food
description: An inspiring documentary showing how embedding environmental principles into design can reduce our societies negative impacts. Of course this is only a way to alleviate the effects of over consumption, consuming as we do now is unsustainable and no current technological fix is going to change that. Still very cool, check it out.

title: The Power Principle
description: This video series goes into the use of power, specifically by the USA and other Western elites, to maintain their power and control of resources in the world.  Highly educating history lesson.

title: Dangerous Knowledge
description: Amazing documentary about some of the greatest minds in mathematics and their mental descent. Every step of the way as they tried to search for new knowledge they were resisted by lesser minds and all ended up with mental health issues. The video almost paints a story of men who looked into the eye of god and it drove them insane, but perhaps it was the mindless resistance of the people around them that had more to do with it.

title: The God Delusion
description: Documentary series by Richard Dawkins illustrating the concepts in his global best seller.

title: Independent Media in a Time of War
description: Amy Goodman, long time activist, gives this wonderful speech about the especially important role independent media has in a time of war.  If you like this, you can watch her every week day on the free internet news show, Democracy Now

title: One man's way
description: Peter Singer wrote a wonderful book about the activist Henry Spira. This documentary follows on from that book, and I think it gives us pause to think about what effective activism is.

title: The Power of Nightmares
description: Another wonderful Adam Curtis documentary. This one contrasts the rise of Al Qaeda and the Neo Conservative movements. Must see history.

title: Guns, Germs and Steel
description: How is it that Europeans came to dominate the globe for four centuries? Jarad Diamond gives an excellent response to this question, in a documentary series of epic proportions. Guns, germs and steel will change the way you think about human culture.

title: The Crusades
description: Terry Jones from Monty Python takes us into the crusades in his own unique style. Brainwashed, avaristic, wretched, the crusaders probably killed more Christians than Muslims.  I could only get the third one here, but worth watching still.

title: The Corporation
description: Amazing documentary about corporations, their history and their role in our culture

title: Post Punk Kitchen
description: Vegan with a Vengeance, Vegan Cupcakes Take Over the World, Veganomicon, they all started here.  A fun vegan cooking show with punk rock..sweet.

One of my favourite books and movies.  War is peace, unfortunately you'll probably hear that line again before too long.  This is the 1956 version, I prefer the modern one but it's hard to keep the link current for copyright violations - Big Brother and all that...

title: Carnism: The Psychology of Eating Meat
description: A really interesting discussion by Melanie Joy.  A great intro into issues.

title: A Cow At My Table
description: A great 1998 film discussing the ethics of animal agriculture.   Packed full of information and informative views.

title: Stop Signs: Cars and Capitalism
description: This is an excellent talk questioning the role of the car in modern society.

title: The Story of Stuff
description: It is our consumption which is destroying the world, both of food and other goods.   The story of stuff goes into the latter, in a fun and entertaining way.

title: The Power Principle
description: This is an awesome documentary series.  With interviews with many of the smartest radical thinkers, this series is a primer to understanding how power has worked in the modern world.

title: One Man's Way
description: Peter Singer's tribute to one of the most effective animal activists of all time Henry Spira.
